---
title: "Example of litedown"
author: "Jihong Zhang"
date: "2024-08-28"
output:
  litedown::html_format:
    options:
      toc: true
      number_sections: true
      embed_resources: false
    meta:
      css: ["default", "@heading-anchor"]
      js: ["@heading-anchor"]
knit: litedown:::knit
---





## Including Plots Here

You can also embed plots now, for example:





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(pressure)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/pressure-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ tidyr::extract() masks rstan::extract()
✖ dplyr::filter()  masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()     masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::
:::





```` md
Below is not a code chunk but verbatim content
inside a fenced code block (with four backticks).

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
1 + 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 2
```


:::
:::

Inline code expressions like 2 are not
parsed, either.
````
